summary: Adds followers based on the classes from previous Elder Scroll games
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds several followers based on the default classes from previous Elder Scroll games.

It is meant to expand on the followers already in game by giving the player interesting options to complement you own character with followers that are recognizable for players of the previous games, and be somewhat clear on their purposes, strengths and weaknesses for players new to the series.

It is important to note that followers do not use several skills that the player does, so all the followers focus on what really matters combat wise to give them flavor and so that they fight in different ways. I will try to improve on this over time.

None of the followers allow you to change their clothes, this is made for flavor, meaning they will look like I imagine the classes look (as much as possible), you will however be allowed to give them weapons.

Some followers will only join you when you fulfill certain requisites.
Examples:
Defeating them in a fist fight.
Bringing them items.
Being a certain level.
Having a certain skill level.
etc.

Initial release completion status and info:

Acrobat - yes, custom voices are messed up, reverting to vanilla voices and dialogue.

Name: Tehriel Benoch
Race: Bosmer (Wood Elf)
Sex: male
Location: Drunken Huntsman, Witherun

Strengths:
Blade
Block
Marksman
Sneak

Either a companion for sneaky characters or ranged support for a warrior type, Tehriel is quite fragile, so avoiding damage is a priority for him. He feels most comfortable with a bow, but will pull a sword and light shield when cornered.


Agent - n
Archer - n
Assassin - n
Barbarian - n
Bard - n
Battlemage - n
Crusader - n
Healer - n
Knight - n
Mage - n
Monk - n
Nightblade - n
Pilgrim - n
Rogue - n
Scout - n
Sorcerer - n
Spellsword - n
Thief - n
Warrior - n
Witch hunter - n




The release schedule will be as follows:

Initial release with only vanilla dialogue and voices.

Second release with custom dialogue, no voice acting, this will flesh out the characters quite bit story wise.

Third release and following ones is where custom voices are added to all the followers, this depends a lot on community contribution.
author: Irinir
